SHARES Updated Date: 28 February 2025 One of the Seven Sister States, Assam is among the most beautiful gems of Northeast India. Bestowed with green and vast tea gardens, snow-clad Himalayan peaks, and myriads of rivers, streams, and lakes, it draws tourists from all across the world. The hill stations in Assam are relatively offbeat and unexplored, but this land of dense forests, undulating plains, and rich cultural heritage is worth visiting. It’s not just the hill stations in Assam that will mesmerize you. The similarities between the culture and lifestyle of Assam and South Eastern Countries will amaze you too. Find out more about the laid-back and picturesque hill stations of Assam in this blog. Table Of Content Best Time To Visit Assam  Summer season, which runs from April to June is the best time to visit Assam. These months are extremely pleasant and refreshing to travel. The climate is also ideal for wildlife safari in Kaziranga National Park (UNESCO World Heritage Site) and hill stations like Haflong, Diphu, and Maibang. Assam is located on the Brahmaputra valley, which is prone to torrential rain and devastating floods, so monsoon season from July to September must be avoided. Winter months in Assam from October to March are comfortable and perfect for a romantic vacation. One can enjoy festivals like Bihu—harvest festival in January— or visit the Orchids in the hills and enjoy the chilling weather. Book Now See more at TRAVELTRIANGLE.COM Visit Website 10 Beautiful Hill Stations In Assam Here is a list of some of the most beautiful hill stations in Assam which one cannot miss. while they are here. From the splendid beauty of the mountains to the beautiful heritage, there is a lot to explore.  Haflong – The Most Splendid And Serene One Diphu – A Peaceful Retreat For Nature Lovers Umrangso – An Unspoilt Picturesque Beauty Maibang – Famed For Relics Of Kachari Kingdom Dispur – The Capital City Sualkuchi – The Town Of Craftsmen Lilabari – Holding The Nature’s Beauty Morigaon – Laidback Town Bongaigaon – Town Of Caves And Temples Karimganj – Home Of Local Tribes 1. Haflong – The Most Splendid And Serene One A perfect collage of lush green hills, sparkling water, and opulent valleys, Haflong is one of the best and most popular hill stations near Guwahati. It is ideal for a secluded and peaceful holiday, which is also blessed with beautiful orchids and birds. Haflong is also a trekker’s paradise and known for adventure sports like paragliding. The hill station is a year-around destination and a one of the must visit places to visit when travelling to North East. Those who are planning to visit in November, must attend Chavang Kut, which is a famous and colourful harvest festival of Haflong. Best Time To Visit: October-February Famous For: The serene and beautiful Haflong Lake is the primary attraction of the little hill station. One can also go for a scenic boat ride in the lake and strolling around. Borali Range and Orchid Garden are other tourist attractions you can visit. Must Read: 33 Tourist Places In Assam: Unveiling The Hidden Charm Of The North-East 2. Diphu – A Peaceful Retreat For Nature Lovers 270 km from Guwahati, Diphu is one of the least-known hill stations in Assam. The pristine beauty of its plush green rolling hills and serene surroundings will leave you awestruck. Diphu is endowed with beautiful temples like Deopani Durga Mandir, Shiva Mandir and Khanduli. It’s also one of the most famous hill stations in Assam for trekking, hiking, and other adventure sports. You can trek to the highest point of Diphu to enjoy stunning views of Brahmaputra Valley. Best Time To Visit: November-December Famous For: It has a beautiful Botanical Garden, a district museum, and Arboretum and Marat Longri National Park Suggested Read: Explore The Himalayas: 48 Best Places To Visit In Himachal Pradesh 3. Umrangso – An Unspoilt Picturesque Beauty Perched on the spectacular North Cachar Hill, Umrangso is amongst the most scenic hill stations in Assam. Located on the border of Assam and Meghalaya, the place has a rustic charm and offers everything that is needed to rejuvenate the mind and soul of a weary city dweller. Umrangso is 104 km from Haflong, a 4-hour-long scenic drive through Jowai and Shillong Hills can take you there. Best Time To Visit: October Onwards Famous For: Garampani, a hot spring located on the top of the hill. It is believed to have medicinal values and offers gorgeous views of the surrounding valley. The spring has formed a lake and people can enjoy boating there. Suggested Read: Our Ultimate Experiences On A Romantic Trip To North East 4. Maibang – Famed For Relics Of Kachari Kingdom Former capital of Kachari kings, Maibang is a scenic and mesmeric hill station in Assam. It’s a place of wonders and those who love traversing the unexplored trails must visit it. This little hill station is known for stone carvings and sculptures of the Kachari dynasty and sparkling waterfalls cascading down the verdant slopes. Best Time To Visit: October-March Famous For: The relics of Kachari Rajbari and the most famous Ramchandi—a unique monolithic ancient temple, locally known as Ek Patthar Ghar. Suggested Read: 33 Tourist Places In Assam: Unveiling The Hidden Charm Of The North-East 5. Dispur – The Capital City  Known to be the capital of Assam, Dispur is blessed with some of the beautiful views to admire and also unique traditions to experience. In 1973, this magnificent hill station was given the title of Assam’s capital and later it became a home to some important buildings like Assam Secretariat, State Emergency Operations center and State Assemble House. Alongside that there are many temples which surround this place and hold great importance. Dispur is also famous for the tea auction market which takes place at the outskirts of Guwahati. Best Time To Visit: November-MarchFamous For: Home to the important buildings of Assam Suggested Read: River Rafting In Assam: A Thrilling Experience In The Heart of Brahmaputra 6. Sualkuchi – The Town Of Craftsmen  This is a small village which reflects the beautiful culture and tradition of Assam in the best possible way. Famous for being a weaving village, this is a home to a vast number of skilled craftsmen who are known for producing the best silk in the state. For this reason, this place is also called the “Manchester of the East”. Not just this, but the bamboo houses are known for their ethnic and rustic beauty which is worth admiring. Alongside that Sualkuchi is also famous for its vast variety of flora and fauna which is worth exploring. Best Time To Visit: November-MarchFamous For: Home to skilled craftsmen Suggested Read: 5 Popular Waterfalls In Assam That Glorify The Beauty Of The State 7. Lilabari – Holding The Nature’s Beauty  This is a small town which is situated at the North Lakhampur in Assam and is known for its surreal beauty. Particularly famous for the waterfront, this place is located close to the bank of Brahmaputra river. This place is beautified by the beauty of the Dirang Valley and the Sela Pass. Alongside that Lilabari is also the place which serves Arunachal Pradesh. Apart from the serene beauty of this little town, this place also offers a wide range of scope to adventure enthusiasts. People can try their hands on trekking, mountaineering, rafting and camping. Best Time To Visit: October-MarchFamous For: Adventure activities  Suggested Read: 5 Picnic Spots Near Guwahati That Encompass The Beauty And Charm Of Assam! 8. Morigaon – Laidback Town  Morigaon is a breathtakingly beautiful place which is known for its beautiful history, and also a rich culture and tradition which is worth exploring. Alongside that there are stories of legends which open like a box of surprises. From the north of this district, River Brahmaputra flows while the west side of the place is covered by the snow capped mountains. Alongside that there is a vastly spread agriculture land where the vegetables are grown. With the beautiful views, Morigaon makes a great place for embracing the enchanting beauty of nature. Best Time To Visit: November-FebruaryFamous For: Architectures from the past, nature’s beauty  Suggested Read: Temples In Assam For A Spiritual Awakening In The Northeast 9. Bongaigaon – Town Of Caves And Temples  This town was once the capital of Kamatapur Kingdom, and in the present holds an important place. There are many historical monuments which reflect Assamese culture and there are also many vibrant Assamese township and culture. The surreal beauty of this town is well preserved and people come here to witness the untouched beauty of Assam. There is also a historical cave and Bhageshwari temple which showcases the history of the place. This town is also famous for the petrochemical industry. Best Time To Visit: October-MayFamous For: Historical architectures and caves  Suggested Read: 8 Godly Places To Visit In Guwahati In May On Your Assam Trip 10. Karimganj – Home Of Local Tribes  Secluded from the chaos of the main city, Karimganj is one of the sleepy towns of Assam. This is the biggest city and also the administrative headquarter of the district. Located at the southernmost part of Assam, this place is perfect to enjoy a great time amidst the lush-greenery. Surrounded by the thick forests, this place holds an important role in the livelihood of the locals. Karimganj is also a home to the local tribes and there are many cultures and traditions which reflect the origins of this place. Best Time To Visit: October-FebruaryFamous For: It is the biggest city of Assam and also home to local tribes  Further Read: 55 Hill Stations Near Delhi for a Peaceful Getaway Traveling to these hill stations in Assam is fun and a lot easier than exploring other places of North Eastern states. If you want to cover the complete North East without must hassle, then booking a trip North East can be a great idea. Frequently Asked Questions About Beautiful Hill Stations In Assam How do I get to Haflong? There are no direct flights or trains to Haflong and the best way to get here is by hiring a taxi from cities like Guwahati. How can I reach Diphu from Guwahati? Diphu is situated at a distance of 270 km from Guwahati and one can either take a taxi or travel by train as there is a local railway station in Diphu. What is the best time to visit Assam? November to March is the best time to visit Assam. Is it safe to visit Assam? Yes, it is safe to visit Assam but it is advised to not roam around by oneself late at night. How many days are enough to explore Assam? One should plan a trip of at least 5 days to cover the various places in Assam. Which are the places that I should include on my trip to Assam? Some of the places to include in one’s trip to Assam are: 1. Kaziranga National Park 2. Manas National Park 3. Kamakhya Temple 4. Majuli Island 5. Hoollongapar Gibbon Wildlife Sanctuary 6.
